description: This table contains data relating to the history of problems from patients' problem lists in the clinical system.

columns.name: PROBLEM_LIST_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of this Problem List entry.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: Used to identify the particular problem within the historical problems

columns.name: HX_PROBLEM_ID
columns.description: ID of the diagnosis associated with this historical problem

columns.name: HX_DESCRIPTION
columns.description: The historical display name of the problem. Only contains data if the default display name is changed.

columns.name: HX_DATE_NOTED
columns.description: Represents the historical value of the first possible date that a problem could have been noted/onset on.    A problem's noted date is documented as a fuzzy date, meaning that it can capture approximate date data ("2012", "1/2012") or exact data ("3/5/2012"). This column captures the earliest date of the effective range. See HX_NOTED_END_DATE for the latest counterpart. For example, if 2012 is documented in hyperspace, then HX_NOTED_DATE will be 1/1/2012 and HX_NOTED_END_DATE will be 12/31/2012.

columns.name: HX_DATE_RESOLVED
columns.description: The date on which this problem was resolved.

columns.name: HX_COMMENT
columns.description: The historical preview text (first characters) of all the Overview notes entered for a Problem List entry.

columns.name: HX_DATE_OF_ENTRY
columns.description: The date that the problem was added to or updated on the patient's Problem List in calendar format.

columns.name: HX_ENTRY_USER_ID
columns.description: The ID of the user who edited this problem on the patient's Problem List. This ID may be encrypted.

columns.name: HX_MYCHART_YN
columns.description:
Indicates this problem was visible on web based chart system when this historical action was recorded.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: HX_CHRONIC_YN
columns.description:
This column indicates whether or not this problem was flagged as chronic as of this historical event.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: HX_PRINCIPAL_YN
columns.description:
This column indicates whether or not this problem was flagged as the principal problem as of this historical event.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: HX_IS_HOSP_YN
columns.description:
This column indicates whether or not this problem was flagged as a hospital problem as of this historical event.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: HX_PRINCIPAL_YN

columns.name: HX_PROBLEM_EPT_CSN
columns.description: Contact Serial Number (CSN) of the patient encounter where this historical problem list was documented.

columns.name: HX_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value associated with the problem's state: Active, Resolved, or Deleted as of this historical event.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Active


Resolved


Deleted

columns.name: HX_LEVEL_URGENCY_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value associated with the level of urgency of the problem at the time this history event was recorded.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: HX_PRIORITY_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value associated with the relative severity of the problem. Problems can be given a priority (e.g., "high, medium, or low" ).  This field shows the category value associated with the priority level assigned to a problem when this action was taken.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: HX_ENTRY_INST
columns.description: The date and time when the problem was updated on the patient's problem list.

columns.name: HX_PROBLEM_POA_C_NAME
columns.description:
This column has the history of the present on admission indicator, which indicates if a hospital problem was present on admission or not.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No


Unknown


Clinically Undetermined


Exempt from POA reporting

columns.name: HX_STAGE_ID
columns.description: This column holds the history of all stages ever associated with this problem.

columns.name: HX_NOTED_END_DATE
columns.description: Represents the historical value of the last possible date that a problem could have been noted/onset on.    A problem's noted date is documented as a fuzzy date, meaning that it can capture approximate date data ("2012", "1/2012") or exact data ("3/5/2012"). This column captures the latest date of the effective range. See HX_NOTED_DATE for the latest counterpart. For example, if 2012 is documented in hyperspace, then HX_NOTED_DATE will be 1/1/2012 and HX_NOTED_END_DATE will be 12/31/2012.  Note that the value may be empty, even if HX_NOTED_DATE is populated

columns.name: HX_DIAG_START_DATE
columns.description: Represents the earliest possible date that a problem could have been diagnosed on at a particular edit. The latest possible date is stored in HX_DIAG_END_DATE.  If these values are the same, then the date is exact rather than fuzzy. For a problem or condition affecting a patient, the diagnosis date is defined as the date when a qualified professional first recognized the presence of that condition with sufficient certainty, regardless of whether it was fully characterized at that time. For diseases such as cancer, this may be the earliest date of a clinical diagnosis from before it was histologically confirmed, not the date of confirmation if that occurred later.

columns.name: HX_DIAG_END_DATE
columns.description: Represents the last possible date that a problem could have been diagnosed on at a particular edit. The earliest possible date is stored in HX_DIAG_START_DATE. If these values are the same, then the date is exact rather than fuzzy. For a problem or condition affecting a patient, the diagnosis date is defined as the date when a qualified professional first recognized the presence of that condition with sufficient certainty, regardless of whether it was fully characterized at that time. For diseases such as cancer, this may be the earliest date of a clinical diagnosis from before it was histologically confirmed, not the date of confirmation if that occurred later.
